arm_group.description: Placebo, then AC2993 5 mcg, then AC2993 5 mcg
Placebo, then AC2993 5 mcg, then AC2993 10 mcg
Placebo 0.02 mL, then Placebo 0.02 mL, then Placebo 0.02 mL
Placebo 0.02 mL, then Placebo 0.02 mL, then Placebo 0.04 mL

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a multicenter, randomized, blinded, placebo-controlled study to assess the effects
      on glucose control of AC2993 as compared to placebo in patients with type 2 diabetes.
      Patients will be randomized into one of two AC2993 treatment arms or to placebo treatment
      and will continue with their required existing diabetes medications (metformin and a
      sulfonylurea) throughout the study.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Effect on Glucose Control of AC2993 in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Subjects with Type 2 diabetes mellitus

          -  Treated with both metformin and a sulfonylurea at defined doses for at least 3 months
             prior to screening

          -  BMI= 27-45 kg/m2

          -  HbA1c value between 7.5% and 11%

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Treated with oral anti-diabetic medications other than metformin and sulfonylurea
             within 3 months of screening

          -  Patients treated previously with AC2993

          -  Patients presently treated with insulin

intervention.description: Placebo Lead In (0.02 mL) for 4 weeks / AC2993 5mcg (0.02 mL) for 4 weeks / AC2993 5mcg (0.02 mL) for 26 weeks - All are subcutaneously injected twice daily
Placebo Lead In (0.02 mL) for 4 weeks / AC2993 5 mcg (0.02 mL) for 4 weeks / AC2993 10 mcg (0.04 mL) for 26 weeks - All are subcutaneously injected twice daily
Placebo Lead In (0.02 mL) for 4 weeks / AC2993 5mcg (0.02 mL) for 4 weeks / AC2993 5mcg (0.02 mL) for 26 weeks - All are subcutaneously injected twice daily
Placebo Lead In (0.02 mL) for 4 weeks / Placebo mcg (0.02 mL) for 4 weeks / Placebo (0.04 mL) for 26 weeks - All are subcutaneously injected twice daily

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Triple-Blind, Parallel-Group, Long-Term, Placebo-Controlled, Multicenter Study to Examine the Effect on Glucose Control (HbA1c) of AC2993 Given Twice Daily in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Treated With Metformin and a Sulfonylurea

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Change in HbA1c from Baseline (Day 1) to study termination (Week 30)
primary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c from Baseline to Week 30

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Change in HbA1c from baseline, measured from Visit 3 (Day 1) to each of the intermediate visits (Baseline (Day 1), Week 2, Week 4, Week 6, Week 12, Week 18, and Week 24)
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c from baseline (Day 1) to each of the intermediate visits
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1), Week 2, Week 4, Week 6, Week 12, Week 18, Week 24

secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects achieving HbA1c target values of < 7% and < 8% by study termination (Week 30)
secondary_outcome.measure: The number of subjects achieving HbA1c target values of < 7% and < 8% by Week 30

secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects achieving HbA1c reductions of > 0.5% and > 1.0% by study termination (Week 30)
secondary_outcome.measure: The number of subjects achieving HbA1c reductions of > 0.5% and > 1.0% by Week 30

secondary_outcome.description: The time it takes subjects to achieve HbA1c target values of < 7% and < 8%
secondary_outcome.measure: The time to achieve specific HbA1c target values of < 7% and < 8%
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1), Week 2, Week 4, Week 6, Week 12, Week 18, Week 24, Week 30

secondary_outcome.description: The time it takes subjects to achieve HbA1c reductions of 0.5% or more and >1.0% or more
secondary_outcome.measure: The time to achieve HbA1c reductions of 0.5% or more and >1.0% or more
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1), Week 2, Week 4, Week 6, Week 12, Week 18, Week 24, Week 30

secondary_outcome.description: Change in body weight (kg) from Baseline to each intermediate visit and Week 30
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in body weight from Baseline to each intermediate visit and Week 30
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1), Week 2, Week 4, Week, 6, Week 12, Week 18, Week 24, Week 30
